div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1510 Khirbet el-Kerak (Hebrew Kinneret), c. 7 km. S of Tiberias, Galilee, 1936 Burial: c. 319 B.C. (Baramki) Contents: 118+ AR Alexander III: 40 lifetime and post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 7, Sicyon 1, Side 1, Tarsus 4, Citium 1, Myriandrus 2, Damascus 1, Aradus 2, Sidon 3, Ace 4, Babylon 13, unc. mint 1) Philip III: 13 tetradr. (Babylon) Sidon: 64 double-shekels (Euagoras II 22, Strato II 13, Mazaeus 7, unc. 22) Tyre: 1 didr. Disposition: Jerusalem â€ Baramki, QDAP 1945, pp. 86-90, illus. Bellinger, Berytus 1950-1, p. 49 Naster, INCJ, p. 5 Kadman, INCJ, hoard 5
